abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings of the Technical Assistance
            Facility (TAF) Project for Sudan were as follows: outcomes
            were moderately satisfactory; the risk to development
            outcome was substantial; the Bank's performance was
            moderately satisfactory; and the grantee performance was
            also moderately satisfactory. Some lessons learned included:
            the experience of a previous similar local project should
            have been made use of when designing this project. The role
            of TAF should concentration coordinating the activities of
            project preparation and training in the same area.
            Institutional arrangements and size and quality of staff are
            critical for the success of a project. They are good
            predictors of project readiness for implementation and
            should be taken care of at the start of the project in order
            to avoid unnecessary 'delays. A necessity for success
            of a project is the full knowledge of the environment within
            which the project is to be implemented and the proper
            understanding of possible risks. The duties of the
            stakeholders of the project should be clearly determined and
            lines of communication should also be clearly identified.
